nodes.name: H2OIsolationForest
nodes.description: Isolation Forest is similar in principle to Random Forest and is built on the basis of decision trees.
nodes.details:
Isolation Forest is similar in principle to Random Forest and is built on the basis of decision trees. Isolation Forest, however, identifies anomalies or outliers rather than profiling normal data points. Isolation Forest isolates observations by randomly selecting a feature and then randomly selecting a split value between the maximum and minimum values of that selected feature. This split depends on how long it takes to separate the points.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/if.html

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: sampleSize
fields.title: Sample Size
fields.description: Number of randomly sampled observations used to train each Isolation Forest tree. Only one of parameters sample_size and sample_rate should be defined. If sample_rate is defined, sample_size will be ignored

fields.name: featuresCols
fields.title: Feature Columns
fields.description: Features to be used for Modelling

fields.name: sampleRate
fields.title: Sample Rate
fields.description: Row sample rate per tree (from 0.0 to 1.0).

fields.name: mtries
fields.title: mtries
fields.description: Number of variables randomly sampled as candidates at each split. If set to -1, defaults to sqrt{p} for classification and p/3 for regression (where p is the # of predictors.

fields.name: contamination
fields.title: Contamination
fields.description: Contamination ratio - the proportion of anomalies in the input dataset. If undefined (-1) the predict function will not mark observations as anomalies and only anomaly score will be returned.

fields.name: ntrees
fields.title: Number of Trees
fields.description: Number of trees.

fields.name: maxDepth
fields.title: Max Depth
fields.description: Maximum tree depth (0 for unlimited).

fields.name: minRows
fields.title: Min Rows
fields.description: Fewest allowed (weighted) observations in a leaf.

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: Seed for pseudo random number generator (if applicable).

fields.name: buildTreeOneNode
fields.title: Build tree one node
fields.description: Enables to run on a single node

fields.name: colSampleRatePerTree
fields.title: Column Sample Rate Per Tree (from 0.0 to 1.0).
fields.description: Column sample rate per tree (from 0.0 to 1.0).

fields.name: colSampleRateChangePerLevel
fields.title: Column Sample Rate change Per Level
fields.description: Relative change of the column sampling rate for every level (must be > 0.0 and <= 2.0).

fields.name: scoreTreeInterval
fields.title: Score Tree Interval
fields.description: Score the model after every so many trees. Disabled if set to 0.

fields.name: categoricalEncoding
fields.title: Categorical Encoding
fields.description: Specify one of the various encoding schemes for handling categorical features

fields.name: ignoreConstCols
fields.title: Ignore Const Columns
fields.description: Ignore constant columns.

fields.name: ignoredCols
fields.title: Ignore Columns
fields.description: Ignore Columns.

fields.name: columnsToCategorical
fields.title: Columns to Categorical
fields.description: Columns to be Categorical encoded

fields.name: scoreEachIteration
fields.title: Score Each Iteration
fields.description: Whether to score during each iteration of model training.

fields.name: stoppingRounds
fields.title: Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Early stopping based on convergence of stopping_metric. Stop if simple moving average of length k of the stopping_metric does not improve for k:=stopping_rounds scoring events (0 to disable).

fields.name: maxRuntimeSecs
fields.title: Max Runtime Secs
fields.description: his argument specifies the maximum time that the AutoML process will run for. If both max_runtime_secs and max_models are specified, then the AutoML run will stop as soon as it hits either of these limits. If neither max_runtime_secs nor max_models are specified, then max_runtime_secs defaults to 3600 seconds (1 hour).

fields.name: stoppingMetric
fields.title: StoppingMetric
fields.description: Metric to use for early stopping (AUTO: logloss for classification, deviance for regression)

fields.name: stoppingTolerance
fields.title: StoppingTolerance
fields.description: Relative tolerance for metric-based stopping criterion (stop if relative improvement is not at least this much)

fields.name: paramKeys
fields.title: Param Name
fields.description: Param Names. eg: maxDepth ,learnRate, nTrees,distribution

fields.name: paramValues
fields.title: Param Value
fields.description: Enter comma separated values.eg: 4,5,6, eg: gaussian, gamma, bernoulli

fields.name: gridStrategy
fields.title: Grid Search Strategy
fields.description: Strategy to use for model hyperparameter search. Cartesian does exhaustive search; RandomDiscrete searches randomly within given time or model limits.

fields.name: gridMaxModels
fields.title: Grid Max Models
fields.description: Maximum number of models to build in the grid search (0 for unlimited).

fields.name: gridMaxRuntimeSecs
fields.title: Grid Max Runtime Seconds
fields.description: Maximum runtime in seconds for the grid search (0 for unlimited).

fields.name: gridStoppingRounds
fields.title: Grid Stopping Rounds
fields.description: Early stopping based on convergence of the metric during grid search (0 to disable).

fields.name: gridStoppingTolerance
fields.title: Grid Stopping Tolerance
fields.description: Tolerance for metric-based stopping criterion during grid search.

fields.name: gridStoppingMetric
fields.title: Grid Stopping Metric
fields.description: Metric to use for early stopping during grid search (AUTO: logloss for classification, deviance for regression).

fields.name: gridParallelism
fields.title: Grid Parallelism
fields.description: Level of parallelism to use when building models in the grid.

fields.name: gridSelectBestModelBy
fields.title: Grid Select Best Model By
fields.description: Metric used to select the best model from the grid.

nodes.name: H2OScore
nodes.details:
H2O Score Node


This node scores a new dataset using an existing H2O model. It takes a trained H2O model and an input DataFrame as input and generates predictions.
nodes.examples:
H2O Score Node Example


Scenario:

Let's say you have trained an H2O model to predict customer churn. You can use the H2O Score node to apply this model to a new dataset of customer data and generate churn predictions.

Configuration:

1. **H2O Model:** Select the trained H2O model to use for scoring from model load node
2. **Output Storage Level:** Choose the storage level for the output DataFrame.

Output:

The node will output a new DataFrame containing the original input data along with the predicted values.

nodes.name: Split With Stratified Sampling
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data by Stratified Sampling.
nodes.details:
Split With Stratified Sampling, which is the preferred way to sample from populations with varing subpopulation sizes.

Returns a stratified sample without replacement based on the fraction given on each stratum.

More details are available at : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/_modules/pyspark/sql/dataframe.html#DataFrame.sampleBy

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Column Name
fields.description: column that defines strata

fields.name: fraction
fields.title: Fraction
fields.description: sampling fraction for each stratum. If a stratum is not specified, we treat its fraction as zero

fields.name: seed
fields.title: Seed
fields.description: random seed

nodes.name: H2OPCA
nodes.description: PCA is commonly used to model without regularization or perform dimensionality reduction. It can also be useful to carry out as a preprocessing step before distance-based algorithms such as K-Means since PCA guarantees that all dimensions of a manifold are orthogonal.
nodes.details:
Principal Components Analysis (PCA) is closely related to Principal Components Regression. The algorithm is carried out on a set of possibly collinear features and performs a transformation to produce a new set of uncorrelated features.

More details are available at : docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/pca.html

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: transform
fields.title: Transform
fields.description: Transformation of training data.

fields.name: pcaMethod
fields.title: PCA Method
fields.description: Specify the algorithm to use for computing the principal components: GramSVD - uses a distributed computation of the Gram matrix, followed by a local SVD; Power - computes the SVD using the power iteration method (experimental); Randomized - uses randomized subspace iteration method; GLRM - fits a generalized low-rank model with L2 loss function and no regularization and solves for the SVD using local matrix algebra (experimental).

fields.name: pcaImpl
fields.title: PCA Implementation
fields.description: Specify the implementation to use for computing PCA (via SVD or EVD): MTJ_EVD_DENSEMATRIX - eigenvalue decompositions for dense matrix using MTJ; MTJ_EVD_SYMMMATRIX - eigenvalue decompositions for symmetric matrix using MTJ; MTJ_SVD_DENSEMATRIX - singular-value decompositions for dense matrix using MTJ; JAMA - eigenvalue decompositions for dense matrix using JAMA. References: JAMA - http://math.nist.gov/javanumerics/jama/; MTJ - https://github.com/fommil/matrix-toolkits-java/.

fields.name: k
fields.title: K
fields.description: Rank of matrix approximation.

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
The prediction H2O frame contains two columns: predict showing a normalized anomaly score, and mean_length showing the average number of splits across all trees to isolate the observation.


These two columns should have the property of inverse proportion by their definition, as the less random splits you need to isolate the observation, the more anomalous it is.

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
Print N Rows Node Details


This node is used to print the first N rows from the incoming dataframe.

The Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

Input Parameters

  • OUTPUT STORAGE LEVEL : Keep this as DEFAULT.
  • TITLE : Enter a short description for the type of information being displayed.
  • NUM ROWS TO PRINT : Set an integer value(N) which controls the number of rows to be displayed(Default N=10).
  • DISPLAY DATA TYPE : Shows the output dataframe column datatypes by default.

Output

  • This node can be used to view, analyze and validate the output of the Dataframe.
nodes.examples:
when input 5 in no of rows,it will show first 5 rows of the table as follows

PartID SupplierID PartName

P9271 S798 Part_D
P523 S955 Part_K
P3201 S332 Part_M
P9634 S527 Part_G
P9345 S850 Part_M

fields.title: Num Rows to Print
fields.description: number of rows to be printed

fields.title: Display Data Type
fields.description: If true display rows DataType

nodes.name: Dataset Structured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset was defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.
nodes.details:
This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc.

The data has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.
nodes.examples:
Dataset Structured Node Example


Scenario:

Let's say you have multiple datasets available in your workflow and you want to select one of them as input for the next node. You can use the Dataset Structured node to choose the desired dataset.

Configuration:

1. **Output Storage Level:** Select the desired storage level for the output DataFrame.
2. **Dataset:** Choose the dataset from the dropdown list.

Output:

The node will output the selected dataset as a DataFrame.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: dataset
fields.title: Dataset
fields.description: Selected Dataset

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.details:
SQL Details


SQL node receives an input data frame. It creates a temporary table on top of that data frame. It executes the provided SQL in the node on the temporary table.

The resulting data frame of running the SQL is passed on to the next node.
nodes.examples:
SQL Examples


Below are some examples of SQL.

Temporary table name used : tempTable

The schema of the Input Dataframe is : id, price, lotsize, bedrooms, bathrms, stories, driveway, recroom, fullbase, gashw, airco, garagepl, prefarea

find the average price of houses


select avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable


find bedrooms with avg price greater than 10000


select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000


details of houses with bedrooms avg price greater than 10000


select tempTable.* , inner_table.avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg_price from
(select bedrooms, avg(price) as avg_price from tempTable group by bedrooms) as temp where avg_price > 10000) as inner_table
JOIN tempTable ON(inner_table.bedrooms = tempTable.bedrooms)
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to InferSchema tab and Infer the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value:
SELECT 
    PatientID,normalized_prediction,Age,Sex,BaselineScoreonHouseBrackmannscale,Timebetweenonsetofsymptomsandstartoftreatment,ReceivedPrednisolone,ReceivedAcyclovir,3MonthScoreonHouseBrackmannscale,FullRecoveryin3Months,9MonthScoreonHouseBrackmannscale,FullRecoveryin9Months,FacialAsymmetryObserved,InabilitytoCloseEye,LossofTaste,PainBehindEar,RecentViralInfection,PreexistingDiabetes,SuddenFacialWeakness,PreexistingHypertension,PainLevel,
    ROUND(normalized_prediction, 2) AS isolated_prediction
FROM 
    fire_temp_table;

fields.description: SQL to be run

if the file already exists selection in save mode determines what happens to the file,append-adds the file data to it overwrite-replaces the file altogether
